title: How to Find Your Mobile Phone's Serial Number Without Taking it Apart

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. Tap the Settings app icon, which resembles a set of gears on a grey background. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap General.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap General. It's near the top of the Settings page, just below the bottom of your iPhone's screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap About.
steps.content: Tap About . This option is at the top of the General page. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down to the "Serial Number" heading.
steps.content: Scroll down to the "Serial Number" heading. You'll find this heading toward the middle of the "About" page.

steps.title: Review the serial number.
steps.content: Review the serial number. The serial number is the collection of numbers and letters to the right of the "Serial Number" heading.

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings.
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings. Swipe down from the top of the screen, then tap the gear-shaped Settings icon in the top-right corner of the resulting drop-down menu. [5] X Research source On some Androids, you may have to use two fingers to swipe down.

steps.title: Scroll all the way down and tap About phone.
steps.content: Scroll all the way down and tap About phone . It's at the very bottom of the Settings page. [6] X Research source You may first have to tap System at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Look for the "Serial number" heading.
steps.content: Look for the "Serial number" heading. Depending on your Android's manufacturer, this option's location will vary; scroll down until you find the "Serial number" heading on the "About phone" page. On some Androids, you may have to tap Status to see the "Serial number" heading. Some Androids may also require you to tap the "Serial number" heading in order to view the number.

steps.title: Review the serial number.
steps.content: Review the serial number. The serial number is a combination of letters and numbers to the right of the "Serial number" heading.

steps.title: Look for the serial number on the outside of the phone.
steps.content: Look for the serial number on the outside of the phone. Some manufacturers will place a non-smartphone's serial number on the back or side of the battery case, though you may need to remove any protective covering from your phone before looking for the serial number. This is relatively uncommon, but it's worth a quick look before moving on to less convenient steps.

steps.title: Check the battery cover.
steps.content: Check the battery cover. In most cases, you'll be able to find the phone's serial number on the inside of the cover that protects the battery. While you'll have to remove this cover to view the serial number, you won't have to disassemble or damage your phone to do so; most flip phones' battery covers slide right off. [7] X Research source Make sure your phone is off before removing the battery cover.

steps.title: Try using the Settings menu.
steps.content: Try using the Settings menu. If your non-smartphone has a "MENU" or "SETTINGS" key, press it, then find the ABOUT or INFO item and select it. You may be able to find your serial number here by using the arrow keys to scroll down.

steps.title: Check your phone's original packaging or receipt.
steps.content: Check your phone's original packaging or receipt. If you still have receipt or packaging from when you purchased the phone, look for the serial number on the sticker or at the bottom of the receipt.

steps.title: Look up your phone on your account.
steps.content: Look up your phone on your account. If you use a traditional carrier such as Verizon Wireless or AT&T (e.g., not a pay-as-you-go plan), you can usually find information about your specific phone by logging into the carrier's website and viewing your account. [8] X Research source You'll usually need to have an email address and a password in order to log in. If you don't know these credentials, consider calling your local carrier to find out what your login information is.

steps.title: Call your local carrier branch and ask for the serial number.
steps.content: Call your local carrier branch and ask for the serial number. In the event that you can't find the serial number on the phone, its packaging, or your online account, you can call your closest carrier branch and ask for the serial number. In order for the branch to provide you with the number, you will have to provide some combination of your name, your date of birth, a PIN, the last four digits of your SSN, and/or your ID number.

steps.title: Contact the phone manufacturer.
steps.content: Contact the phone manufacturer. If you still haven't found the number you're looking for, contact the company who made your phone to find out where it is located. In this case, be sure to contact the manufacturer, not the service provider. Samsung and Lumia are examples of phone manufacturers, while AT&T and Sprint are examples of service providers.
